citation.article-title: Characterization of N2O-producing Xanthomonas-like isolates from biofilters as Stenotrophomonas nitritireducens sp. nov., Luteimonas mephitis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Pseudoxanthomonas broegbernensis gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudoxanthomonas broegbernensis sp. nov.
Pseudoxanthomonas broegbernensis (broeg.ber.nen'sis. M.L. fem. adj. broegbernensis pertaining to Br√∂gbern (location near Lingen/Germany, where the organism was isolated))
Predominant fatty acids are 15:0 iso, 15:0 anteiso, 16:0, 16:1 cis9 and 17:1 iso cis9. 17:0 cyclo and 13:0 iso 3-OH are absent.
The strain reduces nitrite to nitrous oxide, nitrate is not reduced and nitrous oxide is the end-product.
The strain is resistant to erythromycin, streptomycin, nalidixic acid, kanamycin, ampicillin, penicillin G, gentamicin, fucidin, tetracycline and novobiocin.
The strain was isolated from an experimental biofilter supplied with the waste gas of an animal-rendering plant.
The type strain is Pseudoxanthomonas broegbernensis B1616/1T (=DSM 12573T).
